column4: I've installed fglrx and chosen it in dpkg-reconfigure. But still gf
ups
I've installed fglrx and chosen it in dpkg-reconfigure. But still fglrx returns OpenGL vendor string: Mesa project: www.mesa3d.org. What do I do for it to use the ati drivers?
- apt-get  install linux-restricted-modules-`uname -r`
linux-restricted-modules-2.6.15-26-386 is allready the newest version... :(
- grep drm /var/log/Xorg.0.log
- got any 'failed to load kernel module "fglrx"' in there?
yeah
http://pastebin.com/773333
- then you have the same problem I have I think.
the same problem? The same as who?
- yup, exactly the same message I get.
what do we do?
- and your ATI card used to work fine until today?
nah. New Macbook pro
- I think it's because of the trouble with xorg-core today, can't think of any other reason why it wouldn't be able to load the kernel module.
- I just have the complication that I manually installed the 8.27 drivers manually and thought that might be the source of my problems.
but it wqa
- don't think so, since the kernel hasn't been update.
what's wqa?
typo :P but it did't work?
the xorg-core update today caused trouble so I thought maybe it was because of my 8.27 manual install. Yeah it worked earlier, and it worked just fine.
so I tried to go back to 8.25 and thought that perhaps 8.27 files were in there that caused the prob I'm having now.
